main event: Multiple unidentified aerial phenomena sightings occurred in Memphis, Tennessee on 7 April 1949, with witnesses reporting oval-shaped, silver-colored objects exhibiting erratic motion and brilliant luminosity.
interesting points: Witnesses reported 1-7 objects with estimated sizes of a gallon jug, moving at speeds of 50-75 mph and visible for up to 3 hours.
Local newspaper clippings and reports indicated sightings of oval-luminous objects in the western sky by several observers between 0500 and 0600 on 7 April 1949.
Reported objects were seen to make sudden vertical and horizontal turns, were visible by reflection, and had no sound or odor associated with them.
One observer saw these objects through binoculars, estimating their distance to be approximately 500 yards and noting that they seemed to avoid the flight paths of aircraft in the area.
A weather forecaster confirmed clear skies with visibility for up to 15 miles and no unusual aerial phenomena during the reported times.
sighted object: oval-shaped, silver-colored objects exhibiting erratic motion and brilliant luminosity
witnesses: Multiple eyewitnesses including local residents, newspaper reporters, and tower personnel
